subject: Re: R: R: [junit] gui testing
msgSnippet: I think a very useful FAQ would be along the lines of some heuristics or tips on separating program complexity from the GUI to facilitate testing.
messageBody:
I think a very useful FAQ would be along the lines of some heuristics or
tips on separating program complexity from the GUI to facilitate testing.


On Tuesday, June 11, 2002, at 08:56 PM, Bob Koss wrote:

> On 6/11/02 8:38 AM, "Luca Sfarzo" <luca.sfarzo@...> wrote:
>
>> OK.
>> I'm sure, too, that the mediator knows nothing (and must not know
>> anything)
>> about the specific GUI underlying implementation and behavior.
>
> Right.
>
>
>> I was only trying to make an example to tell the fact that every
>> single form
>> of a multi-form GUI driven application can sometimes be considered as
>> an
>> application itself.
>
> It certainly CAN be. Should it?
>
>
>> The only problem is that a single form could have its behavior driven
>> by
>> some data lying inside the depth of the application itself.
>
>
> Yes, in nearly every application, when something happens deep within the
> application, the gui is used to communicate with the user.
>
>
>
>
>>
>> The main fact stil remains: do you all have successfully used JUnit in
>> order
>> to make GUI testing?
>
> We come full circle to the first question I asked this morning - what
> do you
> want to test? GUI is too big - what specifically about the GUI do you
> want
> to test? You CAN test everything except aesthetics. I try very hard to
> move
> any logic out of the gui (and you really do have to work at it) and
> someplace where I can test it, and rely on visual inspection to test the
> gui.
>
>
>
